context: The word 'armastanud' is the past participle form of the Estonian verb 'armastama', which means 'to love'. As a past participle, it indicates an action that has been completed in the past. It can be used with auxiliary verbs to form perfect tenses or as an adjective describing someone who has loved. The word contains the root 'armas-' (love) plus the past participle suffix '-tud/-d'.
